content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:syn="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/" xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/">             <channel rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/search_rss">   <title>Environmental Information Data Centre</title>   <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk</link>    <description>                  These are the search results for the query, showing results 1 to 2.            </description>            <image rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/logo.png"/>    <items>     <rdf:Seq>                <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7af4c236-5148-4d3d-815c-b6451aee67a5"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/aa82fa99-d38c-47a7-9405-f0773edcd7a8"/>            </rdf:Seq>   </items>  </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7af4c236-5148-4d3d-815c-b6451aee67a5">     <title>High resolution nutrient chemistry of the River Frome, Dorset, UK (2004-2006)</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/7af4c236-5148-4d3d-815c-b6451aee67a5</link>     <description>This data resource consists of a nutrient concentration time series for the River Frome at East Stoke, Dorset, gathered between January 2004 and February 2006.  Total phosphorus concentration data was gathered for the full duration of the project. Soluble reactive phosphorus, total oxidisable nitrogen and dissolved reactive silicon concentration was only gathered from Jan 2005 until Feb 2006.  Sampling interval varied throughout the monitoring period, from a minimum of two samples to day, to eight per day during storm events (with an average of three samples per day throughout the duration of the monitoring period).  Samples were taken from the main flow of the river using an automatic water sampler, and analysed using standard colorometric methods, at the CEH Dorset laboratories. Further details of the field and laboratory procedures are outlined in Bowes MJ, Smith JT, Neal C. The value of high resolution nutrient monitoring: a case study of the River Frome, Dorset, UK. Journal of Hydrology 2009; 378: 82-96.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Nuria Bachiller-Jareno</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Nutrient</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Eutrophication</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Hysteresis</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River load estimates</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Chalk river</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>East Stoke</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Wareham</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Dorset</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>UK</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River Frome</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>River</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>2004 - 2006</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>3 samples per day</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Project C02405</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2015-03-16T14:56:27Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/aa82fa99-d38c-47a7-9405-f0773edcd7a8">     <title>Water chemistry data for the River Frome, Dorset, UK, from 1965-2009</title>     <link>http://eidchub.ceh.ac.uk/metadata/aa82fa99-d38c-47a7-9405-f0773edcd7a8</link>     <description>Weekly water quality monitoring of the River Frome at East Stoke, Dorset (National Grid Reference SY 867868).  The dataset consists of  nitrate, soluble reactive phosphorus, dissolved silicon, pH, alkalinity, potassium, sodium, calcium and magnesium concentrations for the entire 44-year monitoring period, with total phosphorus, total dissolved phosphorus, electrical conductivity, water temperature, chloride, sulphate and ammonium concentration data for periods within the monitoring period.  Daily average river flow on the day of sampling (extracted from the National River Flow Archive) is included.  Users of these data must ensure that the conditions of the licence agreement are complied with and the 'Principal Citation Reference' element of this metadata record is cited in full.  (c) Database Right/Copyright NERC - Centre for Ecology & Hydrology and FBA (Freshwater Biological Association). All rights reserved.  </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>Cynthia Davies</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>CEH Water Programme</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Frome</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Dorset</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Southern England</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Long-term</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>CEH Project C00010</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>NERC_DDC</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Chemistry</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Inland water</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>Environmental monitoring facilities</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-08-07T13:35:35Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>EIDC Document Container</dc:type>   </item>     </rdf:RDF>
